title: Workout Instructions
description: Perform each exercise back-to-back with minimal rest. After the last exercise (Plank), rest for 60-90 seconds before starting the next round.

title: 1. Bodyweight Squats
description: Builds overall leg strength in quads, glutes, and hamstrings. Keep your chest up and hips back. The foundation of lower body power for running.

title: 2. Glute Bridges
description: Activates and strengthens the glutes. Strong glutes are crucial for a powerful stride and protecting your lower back from running-related stress.

title: 3. Reverse Lunges
description: Develops single-leg strength and stability, directly translating to better running balance and form. Stepping backward is often gentler on the knees.

title: 4. Push-ups
description: Builds upper body and core strength, helping you maintain good posture and an efficient arm swing. Perform on toes or knees.

title: 5. Superman Y-T-W
description: Lie on your stomach. Lift your chest and arms into a Y-shape, then a T-shape, then a W-shape. Strengthens your entire back and postural muscles.

title: 6. Plank
description: A core stability exercise. A strong core prevents energy leaks from excess torso rotation, making your running form much more efficient.
